definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: The film's post-production will be completed early next year.
sentences.chinese: 這部電影的後期製作將於來年年初完成。

sentences.english: They believe that the absence of the remaining mean that the coming year would be poverty.
sentences.chinese: 他們以爲，倘若沒不足下的酒肉，來年便會貧窶。
其次，我們需要“祝願來年幸運”。

sentences.english: Having leaped from green spring, sad autumn and ruthless winter to next greener summer.
sentences.chinese: 跳過綠春悲秋忍冬和來年更加青綠的夏天。

sentences.english: The Thai lineup was basically the same as in last year's Asian title bout.
sentences.chinese: 泰國的陣容，與來年亞洲錦原賽予冠時基原一樣。

sentences.english: The next spring the seeds should be knocked out of their seed-heads and planted.
sentences.chinese: 來年的春天的種子應被裁減，他們的穀穗和種植的。

sentences.english: We started planning the next year’s garden at once.
sentences.chinese: 我們父子倆馬上開始準備來年的園藝計劃。

sentences.english: To be in the coming year, you certainly will bear sweet scilloides.
sentences.chinese: 待來年，你們肯定還會結出甜甜的棗兒。

sentences.english: But the Prophet passed away before the coming of the next year.
sentences.chinese: 但在來年之前穆聖就歸真了。

sentences.english: To add a big fat little next year, a family of three happy tao tao.
sentences.chinese: 來年添個大胖小，三口之家樂淘淘。

sentences.english: The pig is already round and fat, and will be ready for slaughter next year.
sentences.chinese: 這頭豬已經長得滾瓜溜圓，來年就能出欄了。

sentences.english: Maybe for next year I will skip that week just in case.
sentences.chinese: 也許來年我應該在澳網前那周不參賽。

sentences.english: Though he has lived in Beijing for ten years or so, he still speaks with a heavy accent.
sentences.chinese: 他雖然在北京住了十來年了，可是家鄉口音一點沒改。

sentences.english: Jiao Zi looks like gold coin, implying a wealthy year ahead.
sentences.chinese: 餃子看起來像金元寶，意味來年豐衣足食。

sentences.english: Frank is keeping company with Connie now, and they plan to get married next year.
sentences.chinese: 富蘭克常與康妮約會，他們計劃在來年結婚。

sentences.english: We believe this proportion may grow further in the coming years.
sentences.chinese: 我相信這個份額在來年可能還會增長。

definition: to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to arrive at (place or time)/period/to become due/classifier for events, meetings, elections, sporting fixtures, years (of graduation)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
